thread.title: UCLA Bruins football at Stanford Cardinal: TV channel, start time, how to watch live stream
thread.title_full: UCLA Bruins football at Stanford Cardinal: TV channel, start time, how to watch live stream | OregonLive.com

author: Joel Odom | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: UCLA Bruins football at Stanford Cardinal: TV channel, start time, how to watch live stream
text:
UCLA started the season 4-0 before a loss to Arizona State knocked the Bruins from atop the Pac-12 South. Stanford opened the season with a loss, but the Cardinal have since rattled off four wins in a row to sit atop the Pac-12 North.
Will Stanford stay there after a matchup against the Bruins, or will UCLA grab its first win against the Cardinal since 2008? The No. 15 Cardinal and No. 18 Bruins clash in a Thursday night college football game.
Here's how to watch and follow the game:
What: No. 18 UCLA Bruins (4-1, 1-1 Pac-12) at No. 15 Stanford Cardinal (4-1, 3-0)
When: 7:30 p.m. PDT Thursday
Where: Stanford Stadium, Stanford, California. Capacity: 50,424.
TV channel: ESPN (Comcast 35/735, CenturyLink 602/1602 in Portland area; DirecTV 206; Dish 140)
Commentators: Joe Tessitore (play-by-play), Jesse Palmer (analyst), David Pollack (analyst), Kaylee Hartung (sideline)
Live stream: Cable, satellite and internet customers who subscribe to ESPN can stream the game at ESPN3.com or via the Watch ESPN app .
Latest line: Stanford by 6Â½
Forecast at kickoff: Clear skies, 69 degrees
Series history: UCLA leads the all-time series 45-38-3, but Stanford has won seven in a row. The Bruins' last win came at home in 2008.
